name: Titicaca
hint: The highest navigable lake in the world, on the border of Peru and Bolivia in the Andes

name: Maracaibo
hint: A large brackish tidal bay in Venezuela, one of the oldest lakes in the world, rich in oil deposits

name: Poopo
hint: A saline lake in the Bolivian Altiplano that has repeatedly dried up and refilled in recent years

name: Buenos Aires/General Carrera
hint: A deep glacial lake shared between Argentina and Chile in Patagonia, known by different names in each country

name: Nahuel Huapi
hint: A glacial lake in the Argentine Patagonian Andes, the centerpiece of Argentina's oldest national park

name: Argentino
hint: The largest freshwater lake in Argentina, in Patagonia, fed by glaciers including the famous Perito Moreno

name: Mirim
hint: A large freshwater lake on the border between Brazil and Uruguay in southeastern South America

name: Junin
hint: The second-largest lake in Peru, located in the central Andes at over 4,000 meters elevation
